Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Trouble accessing files in Nuget package when using Packagereference" (#10033) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We are using Nuget package to share a commonly used Class Library project. The class library uses certain Files (xml) which is accessed in few of the functions in the library. While consuming the package we are using 'packagereference' insted of 'package.config'. Problem is the functions that refer to the files (xml) start failing with error 'path not found'. 

The below was tried to fix the error but with no result
- Copy To Output directory option is set on all the xml files that the program refer to.
- Files section was added with reference to the xml files in "*.nuspec" file 

The xml files are seen in the content section of the nuget package. The file names are also seen in the 'project.assets.json'. But with 'package reference' the required files are not getting copied to the base directory of the application consuming the nuget package, which is causing the program to fail. Is there a way to solve this ?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Compare perf & tab-switch bugs between Dev and VS.OE branches" (#9963) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Ability to extend Default Mappings" (#9999) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used:  VS UI : Issue is true across all products

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): latest dev

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate): 16.7.2

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): 

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

So the issue here is in the Nuget.Client I cannot in anyway extend the ability to provide Compatibility mappings from customer frameworks from what I can tell. Everything is harcoded so if I have a setup where I have: 

NetStandard 2.0 Lib is depending on a CustomFramework Lib which is a subset of Netstandard... I will eventually just run into issues where Nuget complains that NetStandard 2.0 is not compatible with that CustomFramework and from what I can tell there is no way for me to change this or extend it to allow for this. Since the Compatibility mappings are hardcoded into Nuget. 

Is there a way to extend this? or add your own Compat/Subset mappings?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can PackageReference specify source (private gallery)?" (#10031) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Hey, just a question - is there a way for a project file to specify (or add) NuGet source that should be used for resolving PackageReferences?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Restore reports incorrect project count numbers for up to date projects & no-op projects. " (#10026) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: In 16.7, when up to date projects count was added, the values were flipped. https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/0df34003a113462cfa02e369491180686a08beaa/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio.Common/Telemetry/RestoreTelemetryEvent.cs#L30-L31
